channel.title: The shadow of the lion
channel.description:
A documentary series on the influences of change in the United Kingdom (England, Great Britain).

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Episode 5: A Way of Life
item.description: Family life and leisure in the British paradox of affluence and economic need; the changing patterns of work and pleasure in the tight little island.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: Work and family

item.title: Episode 9: The Changing Church
item.description: The influence and impotence of the established church in England's changing society, elements of dissent, and the struggle for significance in a modern world.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Episode 10: Modernization of the Monarchy
item.description: The future of the monarchy has been frequently discussed in Britain. This program investigated palace mystique; the diminishing role of royalty, the personalities and the institution; and the place of peerage in the structure of Britain's modern society.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Episode 11: Heather and Hope
item.description: Scotland's feeling of intense pride, clannishness, and growing nationalism has set apart this country north of the border in the broad consideration of Britain's future. This program considers the country's education, culture, religion, and economic upheavals; its shifting population; and its urgent need for highland development.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Episode 6: The Place of the Publican
item.description: The history and tradition of Britain's outstanding institution, the public house; the changing character of the modern pub as influenced by women and the motor car.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: Women's rights

item.title: Episode 7: Young Blood of Britain
item.description: The teenage revolution, the world influence of Carnaby Street, pop music, fads, and the effect of a restless generation on staid and proper Britain.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: Youth

item.title: Episode 1: Dunkirk or Devil-May-Care
item.description: An introduction to the series depicting Britain's current economic and political culture, the influences of change, and the growing conflict between tradition and 20th century needs.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Episode 2: Motor Car Mania
item.description: Factors surrounding the phenomenal increase of automobiles in Britain: economy, safety, planning, customs; also, the characteristics of British motoring habits and highways.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: Episode 13: The Lion and the Eagle
item.description: This program examines Anglo-American relations: areas of misunderstanding, the encroaching age of technology and mutual concerns, and the strain and necessity of allied cooperation.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Episode 8: The Dilemma of the Eleven Plus
item.description: A long look at England's educational system; proposals for comprehensive instruction, concerns over Eton and the public school influence, Oxbridge and higher education.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: Public schools

item.title: Episode 4: London and the Twentieth Century
item.description: Britain's capital, its burgeoning size and influence; the attempts to regulate its growth and to plan its role in the great transition for the future.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Episode 3: Demi-Paradise and Destiny
item.description: Town and country planning in Britain in the light of growing population and urbanization: the organization involved, the problems of population expansion and limited space, new towns, and the old versus the new.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Episode 12: Dark Migration
item.description: The floodgate of Commonwealth immigrants; the centers of concern, the social and economic problems, the human conflict and the growing challenge.
item.dc:creator: Kinzer, William B.
item.dc:subject: World Politics
